Sentencas: Development of high proton conducting, chemically stable electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell application still remains as a major challenge.
Titulo: Yttrium dependent space charge effect on modulating the conductivity of barium zirconate electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In this work, yttrium (0, 5, 10, 15 and 20 mol%) doped barium zirconate synthesised by hydrothermal assisted coprecipitation exhibited highly crystalline cubic perovskite.
Titulo: Yttrium dependent space charge effect on modulating the conductivity of barium zirconate electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that the proton conductivity is higher than oxygen ion conductivity measured in the temperature range of 200-600 degrees C.
Titulo: Yttrium dependent space charge effect on modulating the conductivity of barium zirconate electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The 20 mol% Y doped BaZrO3 exhibited higher protonic conductivity (6.1 mScm(-1)) with an activation energy 0.64 eV under the reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Yttrium dependent space charge effect on modulating the conductivity of barium zirconate electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The Mott -Schottky analysis carried out in hydrogen atmosphere at 200 degrees C revealed that the barrier height of doped BaZrO3 reduced from 0.6 to 0.2 V. The Schottky depletion layer width also decreased from 4 to 2 nm with the increase in yttrium concentration and the boiling water test showed good phase stability.
Titulo: Yttrium dependent space charge effect on modulating the conductivity of barium zirconate electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Our study highlights the critical role of space charge in the grain boundary and its suppression with the increase in dopant concentration.
Titulo: Yttrium dependent space charge effect on modulating the conductivity of barium zirconate electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The results demonstrate that Y doped BaZrO3 sintered at low temperature is a promising candidate as the electrolyte material for the intermediate temperature proton conducting solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Yttrium dependent space charge effect on modulating the conductivity of barium zirconate electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell
